selection_reasoning: Selected a diverse portfolio of the highest-performing algorithms that represent different optimization strategies. The selections include our overall best performer (trial_1_0), along with four trials that showcase complementary approaches: progressive constraint relaxation (trial_2_4), boundary-aware initialization (trial_2_6), physics-based simulation (trial_2_1), and problematic circle refinement (trial_2_2). Together, these selections cover all the most promising techniques identified in our analysis while maintaining high baseline performance. Future generations should aim to combine these approaches, particularly by integrating the multi-start strategy from trial_1_0 with the progressive constraint relaxation from trial_2_4 and the specialized optimization techniques from the other selections.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest overall score (2.610225) using multi-start SLSQP optimization with diverse initializations. Despite being from Generation 1, this remains our best performer and contains core techniques worth refining.
Close second-best (2.608925) that uses a novel progressive constraint relaxation approach with multiple starting configurations. The validation and fixing mechanism is particularly innovative.
Strong performer (2.569715) with a unique boundary-aware initialization strategy and multi-phase optimization that treats interior, boundary, and corner circles differently.
Distinct approach (2.554075) that combines physics-based simulation with mathematical optimization, using adaptive learning rates and constraint softening. Offers fundamentally different mechanics.
Interesting strategic subset approach (2.529251) that focuses on problematic circles with neighbor-based optimization and a dedicated polishing phase for the smallest circles.
